Line_References: Both agents produced comprehensive ABAP to PySpark migration validation scripts with similar semantic intent and workflow structure. Agent 1.0_1 delivered a class-based architecture with extensive pytest testing, while Agent 2.0_1 provided a configuration-driven approach with multiple storage backend support.

Details: Both outputs address identical core objectives: ABAP code parsing, execution simulation, Parquet conversion, distributed storage transfer, PySpark transformation execution, and result comparison. Minor differences in implementation approach (class-based vs function-based) but same overall intent and business logic.

Similar high-level workflow structure but different architectural patterns. Agent 1.0_1 uses object-oriented class-based design with methods, while Agent 2.0_1 uses procedural functions with configuration sections. Both follow logical sequence: parse -> execute -> convert -> transfer -> transform -> compare -> report.

Excellent code structure with proper imports, complete class definition, comprehensive error handling with try-catch blocks, detailed logging configuration, and full pytest test suite covering happy path, edge cases, and boundary conditions.

Good overall structure with configuration management and environment variable usage. However, some areas lack proper exception handling (lines 180-200), incomplete implementation details for HDFS operations (line 95), and missing validation for some edge cases.
Average of individual agent correctness scores: (95 + 85) / 2 = 90. Both outputs demonstrate strong technical competency with proper Python syntax and logical flow.

Line_References: Excellent implementation with comprehensive testing. Consider adding configuration management similar to Agent 2.0_1 for production deployment flexibility.
Strong configuration-driven approach. Enhance error handling consistency throughout the script and complete HDFS implementation details for production readiness.
Both outputs demonstrate high quality. Consider combining the class-based architecture of Agent 1.0_1 with the configuration management approach of Agent 2.0_1 for optimal production deployment.
